meanings.sent2: She always dresses traditionally for special occasions.
meanings.sent3: The cat meowed traditionally when it saw a mouse.
meanings.sent4: The old clock ticked traditionally, marking the passage of time.
meanings.sent5: The aroma of freshly baked bread filled the room traditionally.

meanings.sent1: Families gather traditionally for Thanksgiving dinner.
meanings.sent2: He follows the recipe traditionally passed down from his grandmother.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel danced traditionally around the tree.
meanings.sent4: The river flowed traditionally, following its ancient path.
meanings.sent5: The bells rang traditionally to signal the start of the ceremony.

meanings.sent1: Traditionally, students wear uniforms to school.
meanings.sent2: The store traditionally closes at 9 pm every day.
meanings.sent3: The clouds moved traditionally across the sky.
meanings.sent4: The flowers bloomed traditionally in the spring.
meanings.sent5: The birds chirped traditionally in the early morning.
